ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: design research skills, independent project management, exposure to an array of representational strategies

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths:
- gives you lots of freedom to pursue your own passions

weaknesses:
unfortunately, this class was a bit disappointing in a few areas. firstly, the assignments were all so vague that no matter what I chose to work on, it felt quite random. this also resulted in the fact that everybody was working on such different things that our periodic all-class check-ins often felt pointlessI didn't feel like I could gain much from other people's work because it was SO different from mine. I wish that the projects had more directionI think a defined site might really help. furthermore, "stories and counterstories" was such a broad term that things felt quite disjointed. while readings were interesting, they felt like they barely intersected with the actual work we were doing in class. I know this class was meant to serve as an introductory studio, emphasizing breadth over depth, but this just made me feel ungrounded and lost at points.

while opening up a design studio to everyone from first-year college students to graduate architecture sounds like it might be cool in theory (learn from your peers!), I feel like this was just too broad of a range to bridge

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would probably not recommend this course to another student. I think the course could do with some structural changes to make things more coherent and sequenced. Furthermore, I think the intellectual interests of the class ("stories and counterstories") could better be connected to the actual projects we worked on.
